00025 /*
00026  * lustre/osd-ldiskfs/osd_scrub.h
00027  *
00028  * Shared definitions and declarations for OI scrub.
00029  *
00030  * Author: Fan Yong <yong.fan@whamcloud.com>
00031  */
00032 
00033 #ifndef _OSD_SCRUB_H
00034 # define _OSD_SCRUB_H
00035 
00036 #include "osd_oi.h"
00037 
00038 #define SCRUB_MAGIC_V1                  0x4C5FD252
00039 #define SCRUB_CHECKPOINT_INTERVAL       60
00040 #define SCRUB_OI_BITMAP_SIZE            (OSD_OI_FID_NR_MAX >> 3)
00041 #define SCRUB_WINDOW_SIZE               1024
00042 
00043 enum scrub_status {
00044         /* The scrub file is new created, for new MDT, upgrading from old disk,
00045          * or re-creating the scrub file manually. */
00046         SS_INIT         = 0,
00047 
00048         /* The scrub is checking/repairing the OI files. */
00049         SS_SCANNING     = 1,
00050 
00051         /* The scrub checked/repaired the OI files successfully. */
00052         SS_COMPLETED    = 2,
00053 
00054         /* The scrub failed to check/repair the OI files. */
00055         SS_FAILED       = 3,
00056 
00057         /* The scrub is stopped manually, the OI files may be inconsistent. */
00058         SS_STOPPED      = 4,
00059 
00060         /* The scrub is paused automatically when umount. */
00061         SS_PAUSED       = 5,
00062 
00063         /* The scrub crashed during the scanning, should be restarted. */
00064         SS_CRASHED      = 6,
00065 };
00066 
00067 enum scrub_flags {
00068         /* OI files have been recreated, OI mappings should be re-inserted. */
00069         SF_RECREATED    = 0x0000000000000001ULL,
00070 
00071         /* OI files are invalid, should be rebuild ASAP */
00072         SF_INCONSISTENT = 0x0000000000000002ULL,
00073 
00074         /* OI scrub is triggered automatically. */
00075         SF_AUTO         = 0x0000000000000004ULL,
00076 
00077         /* The device is upgraded from 1.8 format. */
00078         SF_UPGRADE      = 0x0000000000000008ULL,
00079 };
00080 
00081 enum scrub_param {
00082         /* Exit when fail. */
00083         SP_FAILOUT      = 0x0001,
00084 
00085         /* Check only without repairing. */
00086         SP_DRYRUN       = 0x0002,
00087 };
00088 
00089 enum scrub_start {
00090         /* Set failout flag. */
00091         SS_SET_FAILOUT          = 0x00000001,
00092 
00093         /* Clear failout flag. */
00094         SS_CLEAR_FAILOUT        = 0x00000002,
00095 
00096         /* Reset scrub start position. */
00097         SS_RESET                = 0x00000004,
00098 
00099         /* Trigger full scrub automatically. */
00100         SS_AUTO_FULL            = 0x00000008,
00101 
00102         /* Trigger partial scrub automatically. */
00103         SS_AUTO_PARTIAL         = 0x00000010,
00104 
00105         /* Set dryrun flag. */
00106         SS_SET_DRYRUN           = 0x00000020,
00107 
00108         /* Clear dryrun flag. */
00109         SS_CLEAR_DRYRUN         = 0x00000040,
00110 };
00111 
00112 /* The flags here are only used inside OSD, NOT be visible by dump(). */
00113 enum scrub_internal_flags {
00114         /* This is a new formatted device. */
00115         SIF_NO_HANDLE_OLD_FID   = 0x0001,
00116 };
00117 
00118 struct scrub_file {
00119         /* 128-bit uuid for volume. */
00120         __u8    sf_uuid[16];
00121 
00122         /* See 'enum scrub_flags'. */
00123         __u64   sf_flags;
00124 
00125         /* The scrub magic. */
00126         __u32   sf_magic;
00127 
00128         /* See 'enum scrub_status'. */
00129         __u16   sf_status;
00130 
00131         /* See 'enum scrub_param'. */
00132         __u16   sf_param;
00133 
00134         /* The time for the last OI scrub completed. */
00135         __u64   sf_time_last_complete;
00136 
00137         /* The time for the latest OI scrub ran. */
00138         __u64   sf_time_latest_start;
00139 
00140         /* The time for the last OI scrub checkpoint. */
00141         __u64   sf_time_last_checkpoint;
00142 
00143         /* The position for the latest OI scrub started from. */
00144         __u64   sf_pos_latest_start;
00145 
00146         /* The position for the last OI scrub checkpoint. */
00147         __u64   sf_pos_last_checkpoint;
00148 
00149         /* The position for the first should be updated object. */
00150         __u64   sf_pos_first_inconsistent;
00151 
00152         /* How many objects have been checked. */
00153         __u64   sf_items_checked;
00154 
00155         /* How many objects have been updated. */
00156         __u64   sf_items_updated;
00157 
00158         /* How many objects failed to be processed. */
00159         __u64   sf_items_failed;
00160 
00161         /* How many prior objects have been updated during scanning. */
00162         __u64   sf_items_updated_prior;
00163 
00164         /* How many objects marked as LDISKFS_STATE_LUSTRE_NOSCRUB. */
00165         __u64   sf_items_noscrub;
00166 
00167         /* How many IGIF objects. */
00168         __u64   sf_items_igif;
00169 
00170         /* How long the OI scrub has run. */
00171         __u32   sf_run_time;
00172 
00173         /* How many completed OI scrub ran on the device. */
00174         __u32   sf_success_count;
00175 
00176         /* How many OI files. */
00177         __u16   sf_oi_count;
00178 
00179         /* Keep the flags after scrub reset. See 'enum scrub_internal_flags' */
00180         __u16   sf_internal_flags;
00181 
00182         __u32   sf_reserved_1;
00183         __u64   sf_reserved_2[16];
00184 
00185         /* Bitmap for OI files recreated case. */
00186         __u8    sf_oi_bitmap[SCRUB_OI_BITMAP_SIZE];
00187 };
00188 
00189 struct osd_scrub {
00190         struct lvfs_run_ctxt    os_ctxt;
00191         struct ptlrpc_thread    os_thread;
00192         struct osd_idmap_cache  os_oic;
00193         struct list_head        os_inconsistent_items;
00194 
00195         /* write lock for scrub prep/update/post/checkpoint,
00196          * read lock for scrub dump. */
00197         struct rw_semaphore     os_rwsem;
00198         spinlock_t              os_lock;
00199 
00200         /* Scrub file in memory. */
00201         struct scrub_file       os_file;
00202 
00203         /* Buffer for scrub file load/store. */
00204         struct scrub_file       os_file_disk;
00205 
00206         /* Inode for the scrub file. */
00207         struct inode           *os_inode;
00208 
00209         /* The time for last checkpoint, jiffies */
00210         cfs_time_t              os_time_last_checkpoint;
00211 
00212         /* The time for next checkpoint, jiffies */
00213         cfs_time_t              os_time_next_checkpoint;
00214 
00215         /* statistics for /lost+found are in ram only, it will be reset
00216          * when each time the device remount. */
00217 
00218         /* How many objects have been scanned during initial OI scrub. */
00219         __u64                   os_lf_scanned;
00220         /* How many objects have been repaired during initial OI scrub. */
00221         __u64                   os_lf_repaired;
00222         /* How many objects failed to be processed during initial OI scrub. */
00223         __u64                   os_lf_failed;
00224 
00225         /* How many objects have been checked since last checkpoint. */
00226         __u32                   os_new_checked;
00227         __u32                   os_pos_current;
00228         __u32                   os_start_flags;
00229         unsigned int            os_in_prior:1, /* process inconsistent item
00230                                                 * found by RPC prior */
00231                                 os_waiting:1, /* Waiting for scan window. */
00232                                 os_full_speed:1, /* run w/o speed limit */
00233                                 os_paused:1, /* The scrub is paused. */
00234                                 os_convert_igif:1,
00235                                 os_partial_scan:1,
00236                                 os_in_join:1,
00237                                 os_full_scrub:1;
00238         __u64                   os_bad_oimap_count;
00239         __u64                   os_bad_oimap_time;
00240 };
00241 
00242 #endif /* _OSD_SCRUB_H */
